post.description: Upload a single file with content specified in request body.

charsetHunch.description: Character set of the uploaded file.

fileName.description: Desired name for the uploaded file.

folderId.description: Either 'folderId' or 'folderPath' is required. folderId is the ID of the folder the file will be uploaded to.

folderPath.description: Either 'folderPath' or 'folderId' is required. This field represents the destination folder path for the uploaded file. If a path doesn't exist, the system will try to create one.

post.description: Asynchronously imports the file at the given URL into the file manager.

get.description: Check the status of requested import.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: Import by URL task ID

get.description: Search through files in the file manager. Does not display hidden or archived files.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Offset search results by this value. The default offset is 0 and the maximum offset of items for a given search is 10,000. Narrow your search down if you are reaching this limit.

parameters.name: allowsAnonymousAccess
parameters.description: Search files by access. If `true`, will show only public files. If `false`, will show only private files.

parameters.name: createdAt
parameters.description: Search files by time of creation.

parameters.name: createdAtGte
parameters.description: Search files by greater than or equal to time of creation. Can be used with `createdAtLte` to create a range.

parameters.name: createdAtLte
parameters.description: Search files by less than or equal to time of creation. Can be used with `createdAtGte` to create a range.

parameters.name: encoding
parameters.description: Search files by specified encoding.

parameters.name: expiresAt
parameters.description: Search files by exact expires time. Time must be epoch time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: expiresAtGte
parameters.description: Search files by greater than or equal to expires time. Can be used with `expiresAtLte` to create a range.

parameters.name: expiresAtLte
parameters.description: Search files by less than or equal to expires time. Can be used with `expiresAtGte` to create a range.

parameters.name: extension
parameters.description: Search files by given extension.

parameters.name: fileMd5
parameters.description: Search files by a specific md5 hash.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Search files by height of image or video.

parameters.name: heightGte
parameters.description: Search files by greater than or equal to height of image or video. Can be used with `heightLte` to create a range.

parameters.name: heightLte
parameters.description: Search files by less than or equal to height of image or video. Can be used with `heightGte` to create a range.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Search by a list of file IDs.

parameters.name: isUsableInContent
parameters.description: If `true`, shows files that have been marked to be used in new content. If `false`, shows files that should not be used in new content.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of items to return. Default limit is 10, maximum limit is 100.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Search for files containing the given name.

parameters.name: parentFolderIds
parameters.description: Search files within given `folderId`.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Search files by path.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: A list of file properties to return.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Search files by exact file size in bytes.

parameters.name: sizeGte
parameters.description: Search files by greater than or equal to file size. Can be used with `sizeLte` to create a range.

parameters.name: sizeLte
parameters.description: Search files by less than or equal to file size. Can be used with `sizeGte` to create a range.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort files by a given field.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Filter by provided file type.

parameters.name: updatedAt
parameters.description: Search files by time of latest updated.

parameters.name: updatedAtGte
parameters.description: Search files by greater than or equal to time of latest update. Can be used with `updatedAtLte` to create a range.

parameters.name: updatedAtLte
parameters.description: Search files by less than or equal to time of latest update. Can be used with `updatedAtGte` to create a range.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Search by file URL.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Search files by width of image or video.

parameters.name: widthGte
parameters.description: Search files by greater than or equal to width of image or video. Can be used with `widthLte` to create a range.

parameters.name: widthLte
parameters.description: Search files by less than or equal to width of image or video. Can be used with `widthGte` to create a range.

get.description: Retrieve a file by its path.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the file.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: Properties to return in the response.

get.description: Retrieve a file by its ID.

parameters.name: fileId
parameters.description: ID of the desired file.

put.description: Replace existing file data with new file data. Can be used to change image content without having to upload a new file and update all references.

parameters.name: fileId
parameters.description: ID of the desired file.

charsetHunch.description: Character set of given file data.

file.description: File data that will replace existing file in the file manager.

options.description: JSON string representing FileReplaceOptions. Includes options to set the access and expiresAt properties, which will automatically update when the file is replaced.

parameters.name: fileId
parameters.description: FileId to delete

patch.description: Update properties of file by ID.

parameters.name: fileId
parameters.description: ID of file to update

delete.description: Delete a file in accordance with GDPR regulations.

parameters.name: fileId
parameters.description: ID of file to GDPR delete

get.summary: Get signed URL to access private file
get.description: Generates signed URL that allows temporary access to a private file.

parameters.name: fileId
parameters.description: ID of file.

parameters.name: expirationSeconds
parameters.description: How long in seconds the link will provide access to the file.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: For image files. This will resize the image to the desired size before sharing. Does not affect the original file, just the file served by this signed URL.

parameters.name: upscale
parameters.description: If size is provided, this will upscale the image to fit the size dimensions.

get.description: Search for folders. Does not contain hidden or archived folders.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Offset search results by this value. The default offset is 0 and the maximum offset of items for a given search is 10,000. Narrow your search down if you are reaching this limit.

parameters.name: createdAt
parameters.description: Search folders by exact time of creation. Time must be epoch time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: createdAtGte
parameters.description: Search folders by greater than or equal to time of creation. Can be used with createdAtLte to create a range.

parameters.name: createdAtLte
parameters.description: Search folders by less than or equal to time of creation. Can be used with createdAtGte to create a range.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of items to return. Default limit is 10, maximum limit is 100.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Search for folders containing the specified name.

parameters.name: parentFolderIds
parameters.description: Search folders with the given parent folderId.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Search folders by path.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: Properties that should be included in the returned folders.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort results by given property. For example -name sorts by name field descending, name sorts by name field ascending.

parameters.name: updatedAt
parameters.description: Search folders by exact time of latest updated. Time must be epoch time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: updatedAtGte
parameters.description: Search folders by greater than or equal to time of latest update. Can be used with updatedAtLte to create a range.

parameters.name: updatedAtLte
parameters.description: Search folders by less than or equal to time of latest update. Can be used with updatedAtGte to create a range.

post.description: Update properties of folder by given ID. This action happens asynchronously and will update all of the folder's children as well.

get.description: Check status of folder update. Folder updates happen asynchronously.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: The ID of the folder update task.

get.description: Retrieve a folder by its ID.

parameters.name: folderId
parameters.description: ID of desired folder

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: Properties to set on returned folder.

parameters.name: folderId
parameters.description: ID of folder to delete.

patch.summary: Update folder properties by folder ID
patch.description: Update a folder's properties, identified by folder ID.

get.description: Retrieve a folder, identified by its path.

parameters.name: folderPath
parameters.description: Path of desired folder.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: Properties to set on returned folder.

delete.description: Delete a folder, identified by its path.

parameters.name: folderPath
parameters.description: Path of folder to delete

category.description: The main category of the error.

context.description: Additional context-specific information related to the error.

id.description: A unique ID for the error instance.

links.description: URLs linking to documentation or resources associated with the error.

message.description: A human-readable string describing the error and possible remediation steps.

status.description: The HTTP status code associated with the error.

subCategory.description: A more specific error category within each main category.

name.description: New name. If specified the folder's name and fullPath will change. All children of the folder will be updated accordingly.

parentFolderId.description: New parent folderId. If changed, the folder and all it's children will be moved into the specified folder. parentFolderId and parentFolderPath cannot be specified at the same time.

completedAt.description: When the requested changes have been completed.

errors.description: Detailed errors resulting from the task.

links.description: Link to check the status of the task.

numErrors.description: Number of errors resulting from the requested changes.

requestedAt.description: Timestamp representing when the task was requested.

startedAt.description: Timestamp representing when the task was started at.

correlationId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

links.description: A map of link names to associated URIs containing documentation about the error or recommended remediation steps

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

example.message: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)

archived.description: Marks whether the folder is deleted or not.

path.description: Path of the folder in the file manager.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp of the latest update to the folder.

code.description: The status code associated with the error detail

in.description: The name of the field or parameter in which the error was found.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

links.description: Link to check the status of the requested task.

numErrors.description: Number of errors resulting from the task.

requestedAt.description: Timestamp of when the task was requested.

startedAt.description: Timestamp of when the task was started.

access.description: PUBLIC_INDEXABLE: File is publicly accessible by anyone who has the URL. Search engines can index the file. PUBLIC_NOT_INDEXABLE: File is publicly accessible by anyone who has the URL. Search engines *can't* index the file. PRIVATE: File is NOT publicly accessible. Requires a signed URL to see content. Search engines *can't* index the file.

duplicateValidationScope.description: ENTIRE_PORTAL: Look for a duplicate file in the entire account. EXACT_FOLDER: Look for a duplicate file in the provided folder.

duplicateValidationStrategy.description: NONE: Do not run any duplicate validation. REJECT: Reject the upload if a duplicate is found. RETURN_EXISTING: If a duplicate file is found, do not upload a new file and return the found duplicate instead.

expiresAt.description: Specifies the date and time when the file will expire.

folderId.description: One of folderId or folderPath is required. Destination folderId for the uploaded file.

folderPath.description: One of folderPath or folderId is required. Destination folder path for the uploaded file. If the folder path does not exist, there will be an attempt to create the folder path.

name.description: Name to give the resulting file in the file manager.

overwrite.description: If true, will overwrite existing file if one with the same name and extension exists in the given folder. The overwritten file will be deleted and the uploaded file will take its place with a new ID. If unset or set as false, the new file's name will be updated to prevent colliding with existing file if one exists with the same path, name, and extension

ttl.description: Time to live. If specified the file will be deleted after the given time frame. If left unset, the file will exist indefinitely

url.description: URL to download the new file from.

access.description: NONE: Do not run any duplicate validation. REJECT: Reject the upload if a duplicate is found. RETURN_EXISTING: If a duplicate file is found, do not upload a new file and return the found duplicate instead.

isUsableInContent.description: Mark whether the file should be used in new content or not.

parentFolderId.description: FolderId where the file should be moved to. folderId and folderPath parameters cannot be set at the same time.

parentFolderPath.description: Folder path where the file should be moved to. folderId and folderPath parameters cannot be set at the same time.

expiresAt.description: Timestamp of when the URL will no longer grant access to the file.

height.description: For image and video files. The height of the file.

size.description: Size in bytes of the requested file.

type.description: Type of the file. Can be IMG, DOCUMENT, AUDIO, MOVIE, or OTHER.

url.description: Signed URL with access to the specified file. Anyone with this URL will be able to access the file until it expires.

width.description: For image and video files. The width of the file.

SignedUrl.description: Signed Url object with optional ancillary metadata of requested file

before.description: A paging cursor token for retrieving previous pages.

link.description: A URL that can be used to retrieve the previous pages' results.

PreviousPage.description: specifies the paging information needed to retrieve the previous set of results in a paginated API response

parentFolderId.description: FolderId of the parent of the created folder. If not specified, the folder will be created at the root level. parentFolderId and parentFolderPath cannot be set at the same time.

parentPath.description: Path of the parent of the created folder. If not specified the folder will be created at the root level. parentFolderPath and parentFolderId cannot be set at the same time.

id.description: The unique identifier of the folder to be updated.

name.description: The new name for the folder, which will also update the fullPath and all children of the folder.

parentFolderId.description: The ID of the new parent folder, which will move the folder and its children into the specified folder.

links.description: Links for where to check information related to the task. The `status` link gives the URL for where to check the status of the task.

ImportFromUrlTaskLocator.description: Information on the task that has been started, and where to check it's status.

access.description: File access. Can be PUBLIC_INDEXABLE, PUBLIC_NOT_INDEXABLE, PRIVATE.

archivedAt.description: Deletion time of the file object.

createdAt.description: Creation time of the file object.

defaultHostingUrl.description: Default hosting URL of the file. This will use one of HubSpot's provided URLs to serve the file.

extension.description: Extension of the file. ex: .jpg, .png, .gif, .pdf, etc.

fileMd5.description: The MD5 hash of the file.

height.description: For image and video files, the height of the content.

isUsableInContent.description: Previously "archied". Indicates if the file should be used when creating new content like web pages.

parentFolderId.description: ID of the folder the file is in.

path.description: Path of the file in the file manager.

size.description: Size of the file in bytes.

type.description: Type of the file. Can be IMG, DOCUMENT, AUDIO, MOVIE, or OTHER.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp of the latest update to the file.

url.description: URL of the given file. This URL can change depending on the domain settings of the account. Will use the select file hosting domain.

width.description: For image and video files, the width of the content.

after.description: A paging cursor token for retrieving subsequent pages.

link.description: A URL that can be used to retrieve the next page results.

NextPage.description: Specifies the paging information needed to retrieve the next set of results in a paginated API response

links.description: Links for where to check information related to the task. The `status` link gives the URL for where to check the status of the task.

FolderUpdateTaskLocator.description: Information on the task that has been started, and where to check it's status.

scopes.files: Read from and write to my Files
